com.github.methylene.sym

Class Rankings

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.methylene.sym.Rankings

  • public final class Rankings
extends Object
    A collection of methods that return rankings, or operate on rankings.

    • Method Detail

      • isValid

        public static boolean isValid(int[] a)
        Check that the input ranking is valid. In order to be valid, each non-negative integer less than a.length must appear exactly once.
        Parameters:
        a - an array
        Returns:
        true if a is a ranking

      • identity

        public static int[] identity(int length)
        Return the identity ranking
        Parameters:
        length - the length of the ranking
        Returns:
        the identity ranking of the given length

        Find the length that this ranking can be safely trimmed to.
        Parameters:
        ranking - a ranking
        Returns:
        the length that this ranking can be safely trimmed to

        public static int[] trim(int[] ranking)
        If possible, trim ranking to something shorter but equivalent.
        Parameters:
        ranking - a ranking
        Returns:
        the trimmed ranking

      • shift

        public static int[] shift(int n,
                          int[] ranking)
        Return a ranking that acts similar to the input but operates on higher indexes, leaving the lower n indexes unmoved.
        Parameters:
        n - a non-negative number
        ranking - a ranking
        Returns:
        the shifted ranking
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if n is negative

        Returns:
        the input ranking
        Throws:

        public static int[] comp(int[] lhs,

        Multiply two rankings.
        Parameters:

        rhs - another ranking
        Returns:
        the product of the input rankings

      • nextOffset

        public static int nextOffset(int idx,
                             int offset,
                             int[] sorted)
        Find the next position, after idx + offset, of sorted[idx] in a sorted array. For a given element el, iterating this method over the offset element, starting with offset = 0, will enumerate all positions of sorted[idx] in the sorted array.
        Parameters:
        idx - the start index
        offset - the current offset from the start index
        sorted - a sorted array
        Returns:
        the next offset or 0 if there is no next offset

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        i + 1 if i is non-negative, otherwise i

      • unshift

        public static int unshift(int i)
        Undo the shift
        Parameters:
        i - a non-zero int
        Returns:
        i - 1 if i is positive, otherwise i
        See Also:
        shift(int, int[])

      • sort

        public static int[] sort(int[] a)
        Produce a particular ranking that sorts the input when applied to it. For each index i < a.length, the return value satisfies the following property. Let 
        
   int[] sort = sort(a);
   int[] sorted = apply(sort, a);
   int[] unsort = invert(sort);
   int idx = Arrays.binarySearch(sorted, el);
        then for each index i < a.length, the following is true: 
        
   Util.indexOf(a, el, 0) == unsort[idx]
        Parameters:
        a - an array
        Returns:
        a ranking that sorts the input
        See Also:
        apply(int[], int[]), Util.indexOf(int[], int, int)

      • sort

        public static <E extends Comparable> int[] sort(E[] a)

   int[] sort = sort(a);
   int[] sorted = apply(sort, a);
   int[] unsort = invert(sort);

   Util.indexOf(a, el, 0) == unsort[idx]

      • apply

        public static int apply(int[] ranking,
                        int i)
        Check where the ranking moves the index i. The following is true for all j < a.length: 
           apply(ranking, a)[apply(ranking, j)] == a[j];
        This method does not check whether the input ranking is valid.
        Parameters:
        i - a non negative number
        Returns:
        the moved index
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if i is negative

      • apply

        public static <T> T[] apply(int[] ranking,
                            T[] input)
        Apply the ranking to the input array. An element at i is moved to ranking[i]. Indexes that are greater or equal to the length of the ranking are not moved. This method does not check that the first argument is indeed a ranking.
        Parameters:
        ranking - a ranking
        input - an input array
        Returns:
        the result of applying the ranking to the input
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the length of input is less than the length of ranking

      • apply

        public static byte[] apply(int[] ranking,
                           byte[] input)
        Apply the ranking to the input array. An element at i is moved to ranking[i]. Indexes that are greater or equal to the length of the ranking are not moved. This method does not validate that the first argument is indeed a ranking.
        Parameters:
        ranking - a ranking
        input - an input array
        Returns:
        the result of applying the ranking to the input
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the length of input is less than the length of ranking
        ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - can be thrown if the ranking argument is not a ranking

      • apply

        public static short[] apply(int[] ranking,
                            short[] input)
        Apply the ranking to the input array. An element at i is moved to ranking[i]. Indexes that are greater or equal to the length of the ranking are not moved. This method does not validate that the first argument is indeed a ranking.
        Parameters:
        ranking - a ranking
        input - an input array
        Returns:
        the result of applying the ranking to the input
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the length of input is less than the length of ranking
        ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - can be thrown if the ranking argument is not a ranking

        ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - can be thrown if the ranking argument is not a ranking

      • apply

        public static double[] apply(int[] ranking,
                             double[] input)
        Apply the ranking to the input array. An element at i is moved to ranking[i]. Indexes that are greater or equal to the length of the ranking are not moved. This method does not validate that the first argument is indeed a ranking.
        Parameters:
        ranking - a ranking
        input - an input array
        Returns:
        the result of applying the ranking to the input
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the length of input is less than the length of ranking
        ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - can be thrown if the ranking argument is not a ranking

      • apply

        public static boolean[] apply(int[] ranking,
                              boolean[] input)
        Apply the ranking to the input array. An element at i is moved to ranking[i]. Indexes that are greater or equal to the length of the ranking are not moved. This method does not validate that the first argument is indeed a ranking.
        Parameters:
        ranking - a ranking
        input - an input array
        Returns:
        the result of applying the ranking to the input
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the length of input is less than the length of ranking
        ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - can be thrown if the ranking argument is not a ranking

      • apply

        public static char[] apply(int[] ranking,
                           char[] input)
        Apply the ranking to the input array. An element at i is moved to ranking[i]. Indexes that are greater or equal to the length of the ranking are not moved. This method does not validate that the first argument is indeed a ranking.
        Parameters:
        ranking - a ranking
        input - an input array
        Returns:
        the result of applying the ranking to the input
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the length of input is less than the length of ranking
        ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - can be thrown if the ranking argument is not a ranking

      • apply

        public static <E> List<E> apply(int[] ranking,
                                List<E> input)
        Apply the ranking to the input list. An element at i is moved to ranking[i]. Indexes that are greater or equal to the length of the ranking are not moved. This method does not check if the first argument is indeed a ranking, and will have unexpected results otherwise.
        Parameters:
        ranking - a ranking
        input - an input array
        Returns:
        the result of applying the ranking to the input
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the length of input is less than the length of ranking
        ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - can be thrown if the ranking argument is not a ranking

      • shuffle

        public static int[] shuffle(int[] ranking,
                            int[]... args)

      • sorts

        public static boolean sorts(int[] ranking,
                            int[] a)
        Check if the input ranking will sort the input array when applied to it. This method does not check if the first argument is indeed a valid ranking, and will have unexpected results otherwise.
        Parameters:
        a - an array
        ranking - a ranking
        Returns:
        true if the return value of apply(ranking, a) is a sorted array
        See Also:
        isValid(int[])
